Can you explain why the command `curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "2.0", ...` is used to send a transaction to the Verus network?
The command is actually `curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", ...`, not `2.0`. The `jsonrpc` version in this case is indeed `1.0`, not `2.0`.

As json rpc
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "signdata", "params": ['{"address":"Verus Coin Foundation.vrsc@", "createmmr":true, "data":[{"message":"hello world", "encrypttoaddress":"Sapling address"}]}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
